content.question: While the blocks are accelerating in Scenario <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, which of the following forces must have a smaller magnitude than the tension in the string?

choices.label: Neither <math alttext="m sub A, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math> nor <math alttext="m sub B, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math>
Only <math alttext="m sub A, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math>
Only <math alttext="m sub B, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math>

Both <math alttext="m sub A, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="m sub B, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math>

content.answer: Only <math alttext="m sub B, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub><mi>g</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
